title: State-Sponsored Terrorism, Crimes, and Lies - Collection 20
description:
State-Sponsored Terrorism, Crimes, and Lies - Collection 20:

We have 35 titles here:

-  Ayers - Public Enemy; Confessions of an American Dissident (2013)

-  Baldwin - Amnesty International and U.S. Foreign Policy; Human Rights Campaigns in Guatemala, the U.S., and China (2009)

-  Bevernage - History, Memory, and State-Sponsored Violence; Time and Justice (2011)

-  Boot - The Savage Wars of Peace; Small Wars and the Rise of American Power (2002)

-  Burleigh - Small Wars, Faraway Places; Global Insurrection and the Making of the Modern World, 1945-1965 (2013)

-  Celermajer - The Sins of the Nation and the Ritual of Apologies (2009)

-  Dice - Big Brother; the Orwellian Nightmare Come True (2011)

-  Gall - The Wrong Enemy; America in Afghanistan, 2001-2014 (2014)

-  Geraghty - Black Ops; the Rise of Special Forces in the CIA, the SAS, and Mossad (2010)

-  Goldhagen - Worse Than War; Genocide, Eliminationism, and the Ongoing Assault on Humanity (2009)

-  Grayling - Among the Dead Cities; Is the Targeting of Civilians in War Ever Justified (2006)

-  Greenberg - The Least Worst Place; How Guantanamo Became the World's Most Notorious Prison (2009)

-  Hancock & Wexler - Shadow Warfare; the History of America's Undeclared Wars (2014)

-  Hickman - Murder at Camp Delta; a Staff Sergeant's Pursuit of the Truth about Guantanamo Bay (2015)

-  HRW - Getting Away with Torture; the Bush Administration and Mistreatment of Detainees (2011)

-  HRW - Illusion of Justice; Human Rights Abuses in US Terrorism Prosecutions (2014)

-  Kitfield - War & Destiny; How the Bush Revolution in Foreign and Military Affairs Redefined American Power (2005)

-  Lukianoff - Unlearning Liberty; Campus Censorship and the End of American Debate (2012)

-  Macdonald - Soldiers of Fortune; the Twentieth Century Mercenary (1986)

-  Mailer - Why Are We at War (2003)

-  Masferrer & Walker (Eds.) - Counter-Terrorism, Human Rights and the Rule of Law (2013)

-  Miller - The Foundations of Modern Terrorism; State, Society and the Dynamics of Political Violence (2013)

-  Pelton - Licensed to Kill; Hired Guns in the War on Terror (2006)

-  Powell - Licensed to Lie; Exposing Corruption in the Department of Justice (2014)

-  Punch - State Violence, Collusion and the Troubles; Counter Insurgency, Government Deviance and Northern Ireland (2012)

-  Rivera - Story of a Death Foretold; the Coup Against Salvador Allende, September 11, 1973 (2013)

-  Rizzon - Company Man; Thirty Years of Controversy and Crisis in the CIA (2014)

-  Schmitz - Thank God They're on Our Side; the US & Right-Wing Dictatorships, 1921-1965 (1999)

-  Schou - Kill the Messenger; How the CIA's Crack-Cocaine Controversy Destroyed Journalist Gary Webb (2006)

-  Stack - Every Man in the Village is a Liar; an Education in War (2010)

-  Summers - The Arrogance of Power; the Secret World of Richard Nixon (2000)

-  Virilio - The Administration of Fear (2012)

-  Waldrep (Ed.) - Lynching in America; a History in Documents (2006)

-  Williams - Operation Gladio; the Unholy Alliance between the Vatican, the CIA, and the Mafia (2015)

-  Woodward - Veil; the Secret Wars of the CIA, 1981-1987 (1987)
